text: In VIENNA, before flying off to Moscow, Mr. Khrushchov said he hoped his weekend talks with President Kennedy would help 'to establish an enduring peace between nations.' Replying to a farewell speech from Austrian President Schaerf, the Soviet Premier thanked Austria for the hospitality and welcome he had received. 'The Soviet Union has always striven and is striving to safeguard an enduring peace for the peoples, to secure an early solution of the disarmament problem, and to bring about a peaceful settlement of international disputes through negotiations,' he said.

'The Soviet Union has always striven and is striving to safeguard an enduring peace for the peoples, to secure an early solution of the disarmament problem, and to bring about a peaceful settlement of international disputes through negotiations,' he said.
